Package scheduler.tools

Class EditDatabase

java.lang.Object
scheduler.tools.EditDatabase
public class EditDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
Version:
1.0 Handles the updates to the database, including adding, modifying, and deleting customers and appointments.
Author:
Brayden McArthur

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    EditDatabase()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addAppointment​(Appointment appointment)
    Inserts data from the provided Appointment object into the database.
    void addCustomer​(Customer customer)
    Inserts data from the provided customer object into the database.
    void createTestUser()
    Creates the initial test user used for testing the program.
    void deleteAppointment​(Appointment appointment)
    Given an Appointment object, deletes the corresponding Appointment record in the database.
    boolean deleteCustomer​(Customer customer)
    Given a Customer object, deletes the corresponding Customer record in the database by first removing all associated Appointment records that contain the given Customer's ID.
    void modifyAppointment​(Appointment appointment)
    Given an Appointment object, updates the specified Appointment record in the database.
    void modifyCustomer​(Customer customer)
    Given a customer object, updates the specified customer record in the database.

  • Constructor Details

    • EditDatabase

      public EditDatabase()

  • Method Details

    • addCustomer

      public void addCustomer​(Customer customer) throws java.lang.Exception
      Inserts data from the provided customer object into the database. The data from the customer object has already been formatted to match the corresponding column in the database.
      Parameters:
      customer - A Customer object to be copied into the associated fields in the database.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error with the database.

    • modifyCustomer

      public void modifyCustomer​(Customer customer) throws java.lang.Exception
      Given a customer object, updates the specified customer record in the database. Only some of the fields may be updated. Customer ID, Create date, and Created By should not be changed and are thus omitted from the sql statement.
      Parameters:
      customer - A Customer object that will be used to modify a corresponding/existing Customer record.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error with the database.

    • deleteCustomer

      public boolean deleteCustomer​(Customer customer) throws java.lang.Exception
      Given a Customer object, deletes the corresponding Customer record in the database by first removing all associated Appointment records that contain the given Customer's ID. Then deletes the corresponding Customer record in the database.
      Parameters:
      customer - A customer object to be removed from the database.
      Returns:
      Returns True if both sql statements complete successfully. Returns False if they fail.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error with the database.

    • addAppointment

      public void addAppointment​(Appointment appointment) throws java.lang.Exception
      Inserts data from the provided Appointment object into the database. The data from the Appointment object has already been formatted to match the corresponding column in the database.
      Parameters:
      appointment - An Appointment object to be copied into the associated fields in the database.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error with the database.

    • modifyAppointment

      public void modifyAppointment​(Appointment appointment) throws java.lang.Exception
      Given an Appointment object, updates the specified Appointment record in the database. Only some of the fields may be updated. Appointment ID, Create Date, and Created By should not be changed are thus omitted from the sql statement.
      Parameters:
      appointment - An Appointment object that will be used to modify a corresponding/existing Appointment record.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error with the database.

    • deleteAppointment

      public void deleteAppointment​(Appointment appointment) throws java.lang.Exception
      Given an Appointment object, deletes the corresponding Appointment record in the database.
      Parameters:
      appointment - An Appointment object to be removed from the database.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error with the database.

    • createTestUser

      public void createTestUser() throws java.lang.Exception
      Creates the initial test user used for testing the program. If the test user is already in the database, print a message.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in the database.
